embeds.title: k.duke
embeds.description:
Hey there! I'm Kent; I'm 22 years old and I'm your average boring college student who has a huge passion with UX/UI design, technology, and chickens. Some of you probably know me as kentexcitebot or Kent D. through the mockups I designed, like Crostini setup, ChromeOS White UI, and others. I was credited several times by various tech journalists like Chrome Unboxed. I also dive deep into the chromium code and talk in-depth about interesting stuff being worked on by the developers. I enjoy helping others and am working to become part of the Google Product Experts Program.

I started my Chrome OS journey back in late 2017 when my Dell Studio 1535 threw in the towel during my English essay I put off to the last minute (I lost the entire document!). When I saw the Pixelbook on display at Google's pop-up store in Los Angeles around October, I instantly fell in love with it. In a matter of a couple days, I ordered it. Being a Ubuntu user for 4 years and Fedora Linux for 5, Chrome OS felt like home. I've been documenting and researching the technical underpinnings of Chrome OS since.

I joined r/ChromeOS 's Discord server in 2019 when a member in my private Chrome OS Telegram channel (now 47 members) encouraged me to share my knowledge to a larger audience. Although I have made a few posts on the r/ChromeOS subreddit, I was hesitant to join the Discord group. One day, I decided to hop on, and that's when I realized communities like this one offers incredible learning value. I don't regret joining at all!

I currently daily-drive a Google Pixel Slate and live in the Squid app, literally. It's the best note-taking and drawing app out there; believe me, I tried all of them.

I'm usually always pretty busy, but when I have free time, I design mockups, learn about the stock market, and document and research content in the Chromium source code. I also LOVE chickens!! I socialize with my birds almost every day - they're so cute!
